column3: white-space:pre-wrap""><span style=""font-style:normal"">Minecraft has pulled ahead of every other videogame to quickly become the number 1 videogame over the past 10 years. The Lego Group, as always, was quick to cash in on this opportunity. Are the results worth it though? Or has the set quality declined in a rush for money?&nbsp

white-space:pre-wrap"">The eponymous Pillagers make 1 of 2 appearances this year in this set. Arguably, this is better than 21160 The Illager Raid simply because 2 Pillagers are included here as opposed to its 1. If you intended to build a Pillager Army, I would definitely go with this set. These figures are identical and aptly so. Their dark pants are appropriate and their printed torsos are crisp. I especially like their intimidating eyes. The crossbows, however, could have been better molded.

white-space:pre-wrap"">Steve and Alex have been made into minifigures a time or 2 too many. Thankfully, those with a plethora of them can rest assured because a different minifigure is presented as the hero. He is unique to the set and has lovely head and torso printing. Although, I was disappointed to not see any printing on the legs. The shield accessory is remarkably accurate and the axe is flawless. A Minecrafter told me that the knight has markings representing Badlion.

column3: white-space:pre-wrap"">The present set is rather quite perfect. I chuckled at the 2 scarecrows/practice dummies for target practice. They are both fine. The spruce tree next to them should be taller, but works well either way. The tent with crafting table and pumpkin often generates at Pillager Outposts so is a welcome inclusion despite having more common Minecraft elements inside. I like the flower too.

column5: to free the Iron Golem. The build itself is awfully repetitive, but this is expected considering its source material. The cage should have a top. This was not included to ensure the functionality of the lever. The lever is cleverly integrated and works exquisitely every time. Even though the structure is small, I relish the result.

column3: white-space:pre-wrap"">The outstanding problem with this model is the baseplates on which it sits. They are not firmly attached to one another and tend to hold weak.
